newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel oil up, Turkey to buy high, low sulphur.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel oil up, Turkey to buy high, low sulphur.

text.p: NWE high sulphur cracked fuel oil markets were firmer on Monday alongside futures, but traders said business was quiet.
High sulphur barges were firmer and traded at $118 fob ARA. Physical and swaps in ARA were around $3 a tonne up from Friday, despite lacklustre barge demand.
High sulphur cargoes were slightly firmer. A Turkish tender to buy 25-50,000 tonnes of high sulphur, and 55-60,000 tonnes of low sulphur fuel, added support.
Traders were surprised at the tender as Turkey does not usually buy high sulphur cracked fuel oil.

The tender fax from Tupras invited bids for the high sulphur tender related to published low sulphur quotes. Traders thought this may have been a typographical error. Tupras officials were not available for comment.

A U.K. utility bought a small top-up Russian piece on Friday, to add to an existing cargo, at a 50 cent premium to the mean of means of published quotes. At least four Russian cargoes with low water levels were seen available for early November. These were assessed at around $2-$3 over the mean of means of published quotes. --Nicholas Shaxson, London newsroom +44 1715428167
